newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: PT&T says losses trimmed in 1st half 96/97.
newsitem.headline: PT&T says losses trimmed in 1st half 96/97.

text.p: Philippine Telegraph & Telephone Corp (PT&T) reported on Thursday a lower net loss of 26 million pesos in the first half of its its fiscal year 1996/97 compared with 42 million pesos in the same period last year.
The company's fiscal year starts on July 1.

PT&T said its operating revenues in the first half jumped by 25 percent to 302.8 million pesos due to an increase in its voice-based business through its local exchange and international gateway operations.
It turned out an operating income of 8.2 million pesos in the first half against a 6 million-peso operating loss posted in the same period last year.
"We view this increase in operating revenues as a clear sign that PT&T will regain profit status by fiscal year's end," said Jose Luis Santiago, the company president.
As of December 31, 1996, PT&T put into operation 38,000 switch lines in ten local exchange sites while installation is in progress for 52,000 more lines.
"We have put in place a total upgrade program which will improve our competitive advantage and accelerate our return to profit situation in the near future," Santiago said.
